summary: This is a 2020 email from a NYPD detective on an FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force requesting that emails be passed to a 'backpage liaison' for investigation. The emails relate to ads posted in the early to mid-2000s and are described as 'Epstein related.'

persons.name: Detective NYPD FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force
persons.context: The sender of the email, requesting that emails related to Epstein be passed to a backpage liaison for investigation.

events.title: Ads posted on Backpage
events.description: Ads were supposedly posted with specific email addresses on Backpage in the early to mid-2000s, and are now being investigated as part of an Epstein-related case.

events.title: Investigation request for Backpage ads
events.description: A law enforcement officer requests that emails be passed to a backpage liaison to investigate ads posted in the 2000s that are Epstein-related.
personsInvolved: Detective NYPD FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force

keyFacts: The document is a 2020 email from a law enforcement officer on a joint NYPD/FBI task force investigating child exploitation and human trafficking.
The investigation is seeking information about ads posted on Backpage in the early to mid-2000s using specific email addresses.
The ads and associated emails are explicitly described as 'Epstein related,' indicating an ongoing investigative link to Jeffrey Epstein's activities.
The request is to pass information to a 'backpage liaison,' suggesting coordinated efforts between law enforcement and the platform (or its representatives) for investigative purposes.
